sentence.Network_en: Chelsea and Aston Villa were involved in a tug of war for Liverpool's Ray Houghton last night.
sentence.Network_cn: 切尔西队与阿斯顿维拉队昨夜上演了一场夺人大战，争购利物浦的雷·霍顿。

sentence.Network_en: There was no " tug of war " between dye manufacturers and creosote users.
sentence.Network_cn: 在染料制造商和防腐油的使用者之间没有发生对立的 “ 争夺战 ”.

我紧要是打拉锯战(Tug of war)。看看拉的怎么样(How 样)？

entry.def: A tug-of-war is a sports event in which two teams test their strength by pulling against each other on opposite ends of a rope.
You can use tug-of-war to refer to a situation in which two people or groups both want the same thing and are fairly equally matched in their struggle to get it.

example.ex: Chelsea and Aston Villa were involved in a tug of war for Liverpool's Ray Houghton last night.
example.tran: 切尔西队与阿斯顿维拉队昨夜上演了一场夺人大战，争购利物浦的雷·霍顿。

example.ex: …the tug of war between government departments.
example.tran: 政府各部门间势均力敌的争夺

means.word_mean: 1. any hard struggle between equally matched groups
2. a contest in which teams pull of opposite ends of a rope; the team dragged across a central line loses
